questions.text: What color has Oscar on "Sesame Street" been, for most of the show's run?
questions.explanation:
green.

	Oscar lives in a garbage can with his pet worm.

questions.text: Which Estelle played Sophia on "Golden Girls"?
questions.explanation:
Getty.

	Estelle Getty had Parkinson's Disease. She passed away on July 22, 2008.

Geppetto.

	Pinocchio became a real boy after learning that he shouldn't tell lies.

questions.text: What was the name of the giant that David fought in the Bible?
questions.explanation:
Goliath.

	You can read about David and Goliath in 1 Samuel in the Bible.

gregarious.

	Gregarious has the same Latin base as segregation. The base "greg" means "together".

questions.text: The day before Jesus was crucified, where did he pray?
questions.explanation:
Gethsemane.

	You can read about this in "The Bible" in the New Testament.

questions.text: Which cartoon character worked for Spacely Sprockets?
questions.explanation:
George Jetson.

	George Flintstone was the only George listed that didn't exist at all. His name, of course, was Fred Flintstone.

questions.text: "Running" is a lot of fun. In the previous sentence the word "running" is a gerund.
questions.explanation:
True.

	A gerund is a verb that acts as a noun.

questions.text: What animal (as of 2003) is the mascot for Geico Car Insurance?
questions.explanation:
Gecko.

	Geckos are little green lizards and they are the mascot for Geico.

questions.text: Who won the first Super Bowl?
questions.explanation:
Green Bay Packers.

	The Green Bay Packers beat the Kansas City Chiefs 35-10.
